template.name: First_Responder
Civilian
Initializer
Drone

nta.system:
//system Initializer, Civilian;
system Initializer, First_Responder, Civilian, Drone;

query.formula: Pr[<=10000] (<> (((saved * 100 / N_CIVILIANS) >= N_perc) and total_time <= T_scs) )
query.comment: Q1: it is possible for a percentage N_save of all civilians to reach a safe state within time T_scs

plot.title: Probability Density Distribution
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.05, bucket width=2.2204e-16, bucket count=1 Runs: 404 in total, 195 (48.267%) displayed, 209 (51.733%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [16, 16] Mean estimate of displayed sample: ≈ 16

plot.title: Probability Density Confidence Intervals
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.05, bucket width=2.2204e-16, bucket count=1 Runs: 404 in total, 195 (48.267%) displayed, 209 (51.733%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [16, 16] Mean estimate of displayed sample: ≈ 16

plot.title: Probability Distribution
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.05, bucket width=2.2204e-16, bucket count=1 Runs: 404 in total, 195 (48.267%) displayed, 209 (51.733%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [16, 16] Mean estimate of displayed sample: ≈ 16

plot.title: Probability Confidence Intervals
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.05, bucket width=2.2204e-16, bucket count=1 Runs: 404 in total, 195 (48.267%) displayed, 209 (51.733%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [16, 16] Mean estimate of displayed sample: ≈ 16

plot.title: Cumulative Probability Distribution
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.05, bucket width=2.2204e-16, bucket count=1 Runs: 404 in total, 195 (48.267%) displayed, 209 (51.733%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [16, 16] Mean estimate of displayed sample: ≈ 16

plot.title: Cumulative Probability Confidence Intervals
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.05, bucket width=2.2204e-16, bucket count=1 Runs: 404 in total, 195 (48.267%) displayed, 209 (51.733%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [16, 16] Mean estimate of displayed sample: ≈ 16

plot.title: Frequency Histogram
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.05, bucket width=2.2204e-16, bucket count=1 Runs: 404 in total, 195 (48.267%) displayed, 209 (51.733%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [16, 16] Mean estimate of displayed sample: ≈ 16

query.comment: Q2: a percentage N_save of all civilians is always guaranteed to reach a safe state within time T_scs

query.formula: Pr[<=10000] ( [] ( ((forall (i:civ_t) Civilian(i).Dead or Civilian(i).Safe) && (forall (j:fr_t) First_Responder(j).Finished) && (forall (k:dr_t) Drone(k).Finish)) imply ((saved+casualties) == N_CIVILIANS)))
query.comment: System in deadlock only when a scenario is finished (every civilian is either safe or dead)

query.formula: Pr[<=10000] ([] ((sum (i:civ_t) Civilian(i).Danger || Civilian(i).Helped) >= (sum (j:civ_t) Civilian(j).Helping || Civilian(j).ZR_Received) + (sum(k:fr_t) First_Responder(k).FR_Received || First_Responder(k).Helping) ))
query.comment: Number of civilians in danger always more or equal to number of busy FRs plus number of busy ZRs
saved + casualties eventually equal to N_CIVILIANS

plot.title: Probability Density Distribution
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.05, bucket width=0.22222, bucket count=10 Runs: 72 in total, 72 (100%) displayed, 0 (0%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [10, 12] Mean estimate of displayed sample: 10.861 ± 0.23434 (95% CI)

plot.title: Probability Density Confidence Intervals
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.05, bucket width=0.22222, bucket count=10 Runs: 72 in total, 72 (100%) displayed, 0 (0%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [10, 12] Mean estimate of displayed sample: 10.861 ± 0.23434 (95% CI)

query.comment: Number of civilians in helping state always equal to FR busy + ZR busy
